#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Pick out Your First Pet
#Text=Knowing how to pick out your first pet is very important !
#Text=If you do n't know how to pick out your first pet then your first pet experience could be a total disaster !
#Text=Follow these steps and your first pet could be just what you and your family wanted ! ! !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Research .
#Text=Do n't just jump into getting a pet .
#Text=Research is the most important step there is !
#Text=Even if you think research is not that important you thought wrong !
#Text=If you do n't research the kind of pet that would be best for you and your family then getting your pet could be a disaster !
#Text=You need to find a pet that best suites your family .
#Text=Remember that most animals can live many years .
#Text=Example , birds can live up to 85 years .
#Text=Dogs up to 20 years .
#Text=Also remember the vet bills , animals are just like humans , they have to have yearly check ups , shots , ect .
#Text=If you have young children then a small pet like a fish , rabbit , or a hamster would be a good choice .
#Text=If you have older kids then you could probably get a dog , but even then you need to make sure you get the right kind of breed .
#Text=If you did some research and you think a dog would be a good choice for your family , try talking to a breeder and see if they agree with the kind of dog you are planning on getting .
#Text=Pet proof your house .
#Text=Before you get your pet you need to make sure your house will be suitable for your pet .
#Text=If you are getting any rodents or rabbits , it 's best to keep them in a cage inside , maybe on the floor or on a clean desk .
#Text=For birds , get them a bird cage that fits their size and has room to play along with their toys , and feeding dishes .
#Text=Remember to never put their cage up on anything higher than eye level .
#Text=If you are getting a dog or a cat you need to make sure you have a sleeping place for them .
#Text=You need to have a place to put there cage and you also need to make sure you put away any chewable or scratchable objects .
#Text=You also might have to put down newspaper in pets cage so it does not go to the bathroom in its cage .
#Text=Lastly if you are getting a big dog you have to make sure you have enough space so it can run around .
#Text=You should not get a big dog if you live in a small house or an apartment .
#Text=Look around .
#Text=Do n't get the first pet up for offer .
#Text=Once you know what pet you are getting you have to get the right stuff for it .
#Text=Once you get to a store here is what you need to get , If you are getting a small pet you will need a cage , food , water , bedding and maybe a chew stick !
#Text=( Make sure you have a bowl and a bottle for the food . )
#Text=If you are getting a dog you will need a bed , a leash , toys , a collar , food and a water bowl , and maybe a cage if you do not already have one .
#Text=You will also need care and grooming supplies .
#Text=Make sure you get your pet home safely .
#Text=Before you pick up your pet make sure you have a place for it to ride home .
#Text=If you are getting a cat or dog hold it in your arms so it does not jump around , and if you are getting an animal in a cage hold the cage in your arms as well .
#Text=Once you arrive home make the introduction slow so the pet does not get nervous or scared .
#Text=If you do all of these steps then you will have a great experience with your pet !
